action.comment: Provide a safe environment for the client, yourself and other people present.
Gently grasp the client's shoulders with your hands:
Gently shake the shoulders and check if the client responds. For example, ask loudly: Are you okay?
Ask for help from a colleague or bystander. Let someone call 112 or (if applicable) call the CPR team. If you are alone, call yourself
Check breathing. Open the airway, place one hand on the client`s forehead, lift the client's chin with the index and middle fingers of your other hand, tilt the head back slightly

Check the client`s breathing for a maximum of 10 seconds. Listen with your ear above the client`s mouth and nose for a breath. At the same time, see if you see the client's chest rises and falls. Feel with your cheek in front of the client's mouth or nose whether an exhalation is taking place.
Once the AED is within your reach: Turn on the AED and expose the client`s chest.
Follow the instructions of the AED. Remove the electrodes from the package.
Look at the image on the elecktrodes and attach them in the right place on the chest.
Make sure no one touches the client when the AED is analyzing the heart rhythm
Press the shock button when the AED says so. The AED gives a shock.
Start (again) with 30 chest compressions, immediately followed by 2 respirations. Continue to follow the instructions of the AED
Keep doing CPR untill help comes

action.extra: Teken de toedienlijst af en noteer tijdstip, soort medicijn, concentratie, hoeveelheid, wijze van toediening. Noteer tot slot je bevindingen.
